abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Community Living
            Standards Grants or Credit Program Project for Rwanda were
            as follows: outcomes were satisfactory, risk to development
            outcome was low or negligible, Bank performance was
            satisfactory, and Borrower performance was highly
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: targeting is a
            key element of implementing successful social protection
            interventions. It will be imperative that further targeting
            reviews are done to the Vision 2020 Umurenge Program (VUP)
            and other key social protection programs. Such reviews
            should be encouraged as part of implementation both at the
            geographical and household levels and results used to make
            design improvements in the programs. Harmonization and
            alignment of donor and Government of Rwanda (GoR)
            interventions reduce transaction costs for the GoR and
            translate into better programmatic interventions. Timing of
            bank support, especially in a program with far-reaching
            impacts, to coincide with bank's Country Assistance
            Strategy (CAS) and the inception of a government program,
            can be critical. The existence of decentralized governance
            and management structures highly facilitates successful
            implementation of community-targeted social protection
            reforms. Parallel technical assistance support to a
            Development Policy Lending (DPL) operation is the key to
            successful reforms. Continuous systems analysis and taking
            corrective action should be part and parcel of the
            implementation process. There is a growing body of empirical
            evidence of the use of incentives to reward health service
            provides for specific types of results and to motivate
            individuals for health-related behaviors. Investing in
            collaboration with a national research team not only
            strengthens in-country capacity in this technical area, but
            also contributes greatly to the successful implementation,
            management and ownership of an evaluation.
